item.title: Portfolio
item.description: A list of projects I have worked on.

item.title: Comp-Lang-Comp
item.description: A website to help compare the syntaxes of many different programming languages. Created initially out of my notes for the 12in23 Exercism challenge.

item.title: Make A Lisp Implementation
item.description: A Rust implementation of mal - Make a Lisp (a Clojure inspired lisp).

item.title: Tech-Tree-Blog
item.description: A website to hold my blog post and notes on computer science, mathematics, and technology explainers.

item.title: Nomie 6 Stopwatch Plugin
item.description: A plugin I created for Nomie 6 to allow a more unified way ofusing the timer trackers.

item.title: Tymeit
item.description: A privacy respecting time tracker for yourself. Heavily inspired by Nomie.

item.title: Work Projects
item.description: Projects I have worked on for work.

item.title: School Projects
item.description: Projects I have worked on for school. This include my undergraduate work at University of California: Irvine (UCI) and graduate work at University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign (UIUC).

item.title: Withered Away by Team Alpha
item.description: A 2D platforming game for the Capstone class. Lead music, audio, and level designer for the game, and assisted with coding development.

item.title: Collabuilder
item.description: A reinforcement learning project using Project Malmo to make an agent that can build a house.

item.title: Crowded Market
item.description: A Unity game designed to simulate a marketplace using a simple AI implemented using Navigation Mesh and priority queue.

item.title: Energy-Ball
item.description: My first Unity game, adapted from Roll-a-Ball template. Go through the level and build up energy for jumps. Available online on Itch.io.

item.title: Teapot
item.description: The final project for Interactive Graphics class, focusing on using knowledge of the graphics pipeline and applying that to texturing a teapot.

item.title: StrSol
item.description: A (partial) implementation of String Solving with Regex in Haskell using transducers.
